author: elijahgagne
body:
I opened https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6050 with the goal of figuring out how to use SQLite with PowerShell 6. With that issue, I learned how to install packages, but I did not figure out how to import and use them. It was suggested that I open an issue with the SQLite package owners and I did that with https://github.com/aspnet/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite/issues/485. I have learned a lot with that issue, but am still struggling to achieve my original goal of using SQLite with PowerShell 6.

Steps to reproduce
----------------
```powershell
# Install the packages
Install-Package Microsoft.Data.Sqlite -Scope CurrentUser -Verbose
Install-Package Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core -Scope CurrentUser -Verbose

# Import the packages
$Root = "C:\Users\egagn\AppData\Local\PackageManagement\NuGet\Packages"
[void][Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile("$Root\Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core.2.0.0\lib\netstandard2.0\Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll")
[void][Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile("$Root\SQLitePCLRaw.core.1.1.9\lib\netstandard1.1\SQLitePCLRaw.core.dll")

# Try to use the packages
$Connection = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteConnection
$Connection.ConnectionString = "Data Source=C:\vault.db"
```

This results in the following error
```powershell
The following exception occurred while retrieving member "ConnectionString": "Could not load file or assembly 'SQLitePCLRaw.core, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=1488e028ca7ab535'. The system cannot find the file specified."
At line:1 char:1
+ $Connection.ConnectionString = "Data Source=C:\vault.db"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], ExtendedTypeSystemException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CatchFromBaseGetMember
```

If we check which assemblies we have loaded, it appears that `SQLitePCLRaw.core, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=1488e028ca7ab535` is indeed loaded
```
[AppDomain]::CurrentDomain.GetAssemblies() | ? Location -like $Root* | fl

CodeBase               : file:///C:/Users/egagn/AppData/Local/PackageManagement/NuGet/Packages/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core.2.0.0/lib/netstandard2.0/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll
EntryPoint             :
EscapedCodeBase        : file:///C:/Users/egagn/AppData/Local/PackageManagement/NuGet/Packages/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core.2.0.0/lib/netstandard2.0/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll
FullName               : Microsoft.Data.Sqlite, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60
GlobalAssemblyCache    : False
HostContext            : 0
ImageFileMachine       :
ImageRuntimeVersion    : v4.0.30319
Location               : C:\Users\egagn\AppData\Local\PackageManagement\NuGet\Packages\Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core.2.0.0\lib\netstandard2.0\Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll
ManifestModule         : Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll
MetadataToken          :

ReflectionOnly         : False

CodeBase               : file:///C:/Users/egagn/AppData/Local/PackageManagement/NuGet/Packages/SQLitePCLRaw.core.1.1.9/lib/netstandard1.1/SQLitePCLRaw.core.dll
EntryPoint             :
EscapedCodeBase        : file:///C:/Users/egagn/AppData/Local/PackageManagement/NuGet/Packages/SQLitePCLRaw.core.1.1.9/lib/netstandard1.1/SQLitePCLRaw.core.dll
FullName               : SQLitePCLRaw.core, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=1488e028ca7ab535
GlobalAssemblyCache    : False
HostContext            : 0
ImageFileMachine       :

Location               : C:\Users\egagn\AppData\Local\PackageManagement\NuGet\Packages\SQLitePCLRaw.core.1.1.9\lib\netstandard1.1\SQLitePCLRaw.core.dll
ManifestModule         : SQLitePCLRaw.core.dll
MetadataToken          :
PortableExecutableKind :
ReflectionOnly         : False
```

So why am I getting the above error? Do I need to be doing something different for PowerShell 6 to load these libraries?

----------------
